title: Vaccine Makers Curtail Research and Cut Jobs
summary: Federal policies under Robert F. Kennedy Jr. that are hostile to vaccines have “sent a chill through the entire industry,” one scientist said.

title: Should Drug Companies Be Advertising to Consumers?
summary: Aging means “becoming a target” of the industry, one expert said. After decades of debate, politicians of all stripes are proposing bans.

title: Tom Pritzker, Hyatt Heir, Steps Down as Executive Chairman Over Links to Epstein
summary: The member of a prominent and wealthy family, Mr. Pritzker was in regular contact with the financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Columbia Punishes 2 Who Helped Epstein’s Girlfriend Enter Dental College
summary: The release of documents tied to Jeffrey Epstein has sent ripples through the worlds of business, politics and academia, including at Columbia, where he helped his girlfriend gain entry.

title: Despite Epstein’s Toxicity, Steve Bannon Stood by Him, Texts Indicate
summary: Mr. Bannon, a MAGA podcaster, developed a seemingly chummy relationship with Jeffrey Epstein, who was accused of sex trafficking. He said it was in the name of getting Mr. Epstein to open up.

title: Robert Duvall, ‘Godfather’ and ‘Apocalypse Now’ Actor, Dies at 95
summary: An Oscar winner, he was known for disappearing into wide-ranging roles in movies like “Apocalypse Now” and “The Godfather” and in the television series “Lonesome Dove.”

title: Where to Watch Robert Duvall’s Top Performances
summary: He played rugged, capable men drawn from America’s past, present and possible future.

title: Robert Duvall: A Life in Pictures
summary: The actor, who had a knack for embodying a wealth of varied characters, had a sprawling and celebrated career.

title: ‘Tina’ and ‘Milo’ Olympic Mascot Toys Are Almost as Tough to Get as a Medal
summary: Fans have fallen hard for plush dolls representing Tina and Milo, the mascots of Italy’s Winter Games.

summary: The new governor of Virginia, who ran as a centrist Democrat and a former intelligence officer, says the attacks are a sign of her success.

summary: It’s not too early to consider the connection, and readers also have questions about the economy.

summary: During their visit, a pair of Democratic senators made the case for Congress to impose harsh penalties on Moscow for its continuing offensive.

title: 2 Killed in Shooting at High School Hockey Game in Rhode Island
summary: The shooter was also dead, apparently by a self-inflicted gunshot wound, the authorities said. The shooting, which the police described as a “targeted event,” happened at the Dennis M. Lynch Arena in Pawtucket.

title: Progress in Guthrie Case Is Fitful as Search Enters Its Third Week
summary: Late-night bursts of activity have yielded few visible results as investigators hunt for Nancy Guthrie, the mother of a “Today” show host. The sheriff said Monday that her children and their spouses are not suspects.

title: Kansas Town Supports Mayor Charged With Voting Illegally
summary: The Mexican-born mayor of Coldwater was accused of voting illegally as a noncitizen. Many of his neighbors want state and federal officials to back off.

title: After Trip to Germany, AOC Expresses Frustrations
summary: The congresswoman argued in an interview that presidential speculation, which included scrutiny of her slip-ups, had overshadowed her anti-authoritarian message at the Munich Security Conference.

title: How the H-1B Visa Debate Is Driving a Wave of Racism Against South Asians
summary: A dispute over the impact of H-1B visas on U.S. workers has been overshadowed by racist rhetoric, with troubling echoes of the great replacement conspiracy theory.

title: Teacher Killed in Crash After Man Fled in Car From ICE, Police Say
summary: The man, who federal officials said had entered the United States illegally, was arrested and charged with first-degree homicide after the crash in Savannah, Ga., according to the county police.

title: How Spain Is Carving a Different Path on Immigration
summary: The country is hoping its new amnesty for undocumented immigrants will avoid a public backlash.

title: Frederick Wiseman, 96, Penetrating Documentarian of Institutions, Dies
summary: He exposed abuses in films like “Titicut Follies,” a once-banned portrait of a mental hospital, but ranged widely in subject matter, from a Queens neighborhood to a French restaurant.

title: Dinner Is Being Recorded, Whether You Know It or Not
summary: As Meta smart glasses capture scenes in restaurants for social media, service workers and customers are becoming captive participants.

title: What Does Body Positivity Mean in This New Weight Loss Era?
summary: Can you love your body and still want to lose weight?

title: An Alternative to the Supreme Court’s Originalism
summary: Outside of law school classrooms, the liberal constitutional agenda is failing. Enter the American Constitution Society.

summary: Mr. Cooper said in a statement that he was leaving as a correspondent for the show to focus on his CNN program and spend more time with his children.

title: Manhattan’s Only Wild Turkey Has Her Own Entourage
summary: Astoria, first spotted in Queens last spring, is now a resident of Lower Manhattan, where three devoted women watch over her.

title: Dana Eden, Co-Creator of ‘Tehran,’ Dies During Filming of Fourth Season
summary: Ms. Eden, 52, who was also an executive producer of the Emmy-winning show, was found in a hotel room in Athens. Greek police said they did not suspect foul play.

title: Winter Storms Could Bring 8 Feet of Snow to Parts of California
summary: The greatest impact is expected across Northern California, where a pair of powerful storms began on Sunday night and were forecast to last into the week.
